title: Prohibits disclosure of address or telephone number of victim of or witness to a crime in open court
summary: Requires courts during a criminal trial or hearing to prohibit the disclosure of the address and telephone number of any victim of or witness to the crime to which such trial or hearing relates; prohibits such victims and witnesses from being required to disclose such information in open court.

       Introduced  by M. of A. PHEFFER, ENGLEBRIGHT -- Multi-Sponsored by -- M.
         of A. MAGEE, TOWNS -- read once  and  referred  to  the  Committee  on
         Governmental Operations

       AN  ACT to amend the civil rights law, in relation to confidentiality of
         victims' and witnesses' addresses and telephone numbers during a trial
         or hearing related to a criminal prosecution

         THE PEOPLE OF THE STATE OF NEW YORK, REPRESENTED IN SENATE AND  ASSEM-
       BLY, DO ENACT AS FOLLOWS:

    1    Section  1.  The  civil  rights law is amended by adding a new section
    2  50-f to read as follows:
    3    S 50-F. CONFIDENTIALITY OF VICTIM AND WITNESS  ADDRESS  AND  TELEPHONE
    4  NUMBER  DURING  A  TRIAL  OR  HEARING RELATED TO A CRIMINAL PROSECUTION.
    5  DURING A TRIAL OR HEARING RELATED TO A CRIMINAL PROSECUTION,  THE  COURT
    6  SHALL  REQUIRE  THAT  THE RESIDENCE ADDRESS AND TELEPHONE NUMBER AND THE
    7  PLACE OF BUSINESS NAME, ADDRESS AND TELEPHONE NUMBER OF ANY VICTIM OF OR
    8  WITNESS TO THE CRIME SHALL NOT BE DISCLOSED IN OPEN COURT, AND THAT SUCH
    9  VICTIM OR WITNESS SHALL NOT BE REQUIRED  TO  PROVIDE  THE  RESIDENCE  OR
   10  PLACE  OF  BUSINESS  NAME,  ADDRESS OR TELEPHONE NUMBER AND THE PLACE OF
   11  BUSINESS NAME, ADDRESS AND TELEPHONE NUMBER OF ANY VICTIM OR WITNESS  TO
   12  THE  CRIME IN RESPONSE TO DEFENSE OR PROSECUTION QUESTIONING, UNLESS THE
   13  COURT DETERMINES THAT THERE IS A CLEAR NEED FOR SUCH DISCLOSURE  BECAUSE
   14  THE INFORMATION IS NECESSARY AND RELEVANT TO THE FACTS OF THE CASE OR TO
   15  THE  CREDIBILITY  OF  THE  WITNESS. THE BURDEN TO ESTABLISH THE NEED AND
   16  RELEVANCE FOR DISCLOSURE SHALL BE ON THE DEFENSE OR  THE  PARTY  SEEKING
   17  DISCLOSURE.
   18    S 2. This act shall take effect immediately.


        EXPLANATION--Matter in ITALICS (underscored) is new; matter in brackets
                             [ ] is old law to be omitted.
